<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Next, we'll determine if ask posts or show posts receive more comments on average.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [6]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">## ask comments ##</span>
<span class="n">total_ask_comments</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">0</span>

<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">ask_row</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">ask_posts</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="n">num_comments</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ask_row</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">])</span>
    <span class="n">total_ask_comments</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="n">num_comments</span>
    
<span class="n">avg_ask_comments</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">total_ask_comments</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ask_posts</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">avg_ask_comments</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1">## show comments ##</span>
<span class="n">total_show_comments</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">0</span>

<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">show_row</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">show_posts</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="n">num_comments</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">show_row</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">])</span>
    <span class="n">total_show_comments</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="n">num_comments</span>
    
<span class="n">avg_show_comments</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">total_show_comments</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">show_posts</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">avg_show_comments</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>10.393478498741656
4.886099625910612
</pre>
</div>

</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>As we can see, ask posts average a bit over 10 comments per post, while show posts average roughly 5 comments per post. As a result, we can conclude that ask posts have over double the comments of show posts.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<hr>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Finding-the-amount-of-ask-posts-and-comments-by-hour-create">Finding the amount of ask posts and comments by hour create<a class="anchor-link" href="#Finding-the-amount-of-ask-posts-and-comments-by-hour-create">¶</a></h2><p>Since ask posts are more likely to receive comments, we'll focus our remaining analysis just on these posts.</p>
<p>Next we'll determine if ask posts created at a certain time are more likely to attract comments. We'll use the following steps to perform this analysis:</p>
<ol>
<li>calculate the amount of ask posts created in each hour of the day, along with the number of comments received</li>
<li>calculate the average number of comments ask posts receive by hour created</li>
</ol>
<p>We'll use the <code>datetime</code> module to work with the data in the <code>created_at</code> column. We can use the <code>datetime.strptime()</code> constructor to parse dates stored as strings and return datetime objects.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [7]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">datetime</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">dt</span>

<span class="n">result_list</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[]</span>

<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">post</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">ask_posts</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="n">created_at</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">post</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">6</span><span class="p">]</span>  <span class="c1"># time the post was created</span>
    <span class="n">num_comments</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">int</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">post</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">])</span>  <span class="c1"># number of comments the post has</span>
    <span class="n">result_list</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="n">created_at</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">num_comments</span><span class="p">])</span>
    
<span class="n">counts_by_hour</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{}</span>
<span class="n">comments_by_hour</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{}</span>

<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">row</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">result_list</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="n">date</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">dt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">datetime</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">strptime</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">row</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="s1">'%m/</span><span class="si">%d</span><span class="s1">/%Y %H:%M'</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">hour</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">date</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">strftime</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'%H'</span><span class="p">)</span>
    
    <span class="c1"># create frequency tables</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">hour</span> <span class="ow">not</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">counts_by_hour</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">counts_by_hour</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">hour</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1</span>
        <span class="n">comments_by_hour</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">hour</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">row</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">counts_by_hour</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">hour</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="mi">1</span>
        <span class="n">comments_by_hour</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">hour</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="n">row</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span>
        
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">counts_by_hour</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">comments_by_hour</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>{'02': 269, '01': 282, '22': 383, '21': 518, '19': 552, '17': 587, '15': 646, '14': 513, '13': 444, '11': 312, '10': 282, '09': 222, '07': 226, '03': 271, '23': 343, '20': 510, '16': 579, '08': 257, '00': 301, '18': 614, '12': 342, '04': 243, '06': 234, '05': 209}

</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<hr>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Calculating-the-average-number-of-comments-for-Ask-HN-posts-by-hour">Calculating the average number of comments for Ask HN posts by hour<a class="anchor-link" href="#Calculating-the-average-number-of-comments-for-Ask-HN-posts-by-hour">¶</a></h2><p>We now have two dictionaries:</p>
<ul>
<li><code>counts_by_hour</code>: contains the number of ask posts created during each hour of the day</li>
<li><code>comments_by_hour</code>: contains the corresponding number of comments ask posts created at each hour received</li>
</ul>
<p>Next, we'll use these two dictionaries to calculate the average number of comments for posts created during each hour of the day.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [8]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">avg_by_hour</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[]</span>

<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">key</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">value</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">comments_by_hour</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">items</span><span class="p">():</span>
    <span class="n">avg_by_hour</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="n">key</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">value</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="n">counts_by_hour</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">key</span><span class="p">])])</span>
    
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">avg_by_hour</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>[['02', 11.137546468401487], ['01', 7.407801418439717], ['22', 8.804177545691905], ['21', 8.687258687258687], ['19', 7.163043478260869], ['17', 9.449744463373083], ['15', 28.676470588235293], ['14', 9.692007797270955], ['13', 16.31756756756757], ['11', 8.96474358974359], ['10', 10.684397163120567], ['09', 6.653153153153153], ['07', 7.013274336283186], ['03', 7.948339483394834], ['23', 6.696793002915452], ['20', 8.749019607843136], ['16', 7.713298791018998], ['08', 9.190661478599221], ['00', 7.5647840531561465], ['18', 7.94299674267101], ['12', 12.380116959064328], ['04', 9.7119341563786], ['06', 6.782051282051282], ['05', 8.794258373205741]]
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<hr>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Sorting-and-printing-values-form-a-list-of-lists">Sorting and printing values form a list of lists<a class="anchor-link" href="#Sorting-and-printing-values-form-a-list-of-lists">¶</a></h2><p>Let's finish by sorting this list of lists and printing the five highest values in a format that's easier to read.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [9]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">swap_avg_by_hour</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[]</span>

<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">row</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">avg_by_hour</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="n">swap_avg_by_hour</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="n">row</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">row</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]])</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">swap_avg_by_hour</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="n">sorted_swap</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">sorted</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">swap_avg_by_hour</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">reverse</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">row</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">sorted_swap</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="n">template</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'</span><span class="si">{hour}</span><span class="s1">: </span><span class="si">{comments:.2f}</span><span class="s1"> average comments per post'</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">template</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">hour</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">dt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">datetime</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">strptime</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">row</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="s1">'%H'</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">strftime</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'%H:%M'</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="n">comments</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">row</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]))</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>[[11.137546468401487, '02'], [7.407801418439717, '01'], [8.804177545691905, '22'], [8.687258687258687, '21'], [7.163043478260869, '19'], [9.449744463373083, '17'], [28.676470588235293, '15'], [9.692007797270955, '14'], [16.31756756756757, '13'], [8.96474358974359, '11'], [10.684397163120567, '10'], [6.653153153153153, '09'], [7.013274336283186, '07'], [7.948339483394834, '03'], [6.696793002915452, '23'], [8.749019607843136, '20'], [7.713298791018998, '16'], [9.190661478599221, '08'], [7.5647840531561465, '00'], [7.94299674267101, '18'], [12.380116959064328, '12'], [9.7119341563786, '04'], [6.782051282051282, '06'], [8.794258373205741, '05']]

15:00: 28.68 average comments per post

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<hr>

</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Conclusions">Conclusions<a class="anchor-link" href="#Conclusions">¶</a></h2><p>As shown from the previous output, we can see that the posts that average the most comments are posted around 15:00 or 3:00 PM. In fact, the top 3 most common hours all belong in the early afternoon. On the other hand, the least popular time is 9:00 AM, followed by 11:00 PM.</p>
<p>We concluded that if looking to receive replies and comments, the best time to post on Hacker News would be during the "middle" of the day, such as during the afternoon. The worst time to post would be on the extreme ends of the day, such as early morning or late night.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>

.prompt {

 * monospace font with inconsistent normal/bold/italic height.  See

 */
.CodeMirror {
  line-height: 1.21429em;

  /* Changed to auto to autogrow */

}
.CodeMirror-scroll {

  overflow-y: hidden;

}
.CodeMirror-lines {
  /* In CM2, this used to be 0.4em, but in CM3 it went to 4px. We need the em value because */
  /* we have set a different line-height and want this to scale with that. */

       that horizontal padding will be set on CodeMirror pre */
  padding: 0.4em 0;

  padding: 0 0.4em;

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h1 id="Profitable-App-Profiles-for-the-App-Store-and-Google-Play-Markets">Profitable App Profiles for the App Store and Google Play Markets<a class="anchor-link" href="#Profitable-App-Profiles-for-the-App-Store-and-Google-Play-Markets">¶</a></h1>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Analyzing-mobile-data">Analyzing mobile data<a class="anchor-link" href="#Analyzing-mobile-data">¶</a></h2><p>For this project, we'll pretend we're working as data analysts for a company that builds Android and iOS mobile apps. We only build apps that are free to download and install, and our main source of revenue consist of in-app ads. This means our revenue for any given app is mostly influenced by the number of users who use our app – the more users that see and engage with the ads, the better.</p>
<p>Our goal for this project is to analyze data to help our developers understand what type of apps are likely to attract more users.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<hr>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Opening-and-exploring-the-data">Opening and exploring the data<a class="anchor-link" href="#Opening-and-exploring-the-data">¶</a></h2><p>As of September 2018, there were approximately 2 million iOS apps available on the App Store, and 2.1 million Android apps on Google Play. There are two data sets that seem suitable for our goals:</p>
<ul>
<li>a data set containing data about approximately 10,000 Android apps from Google Play; the data was collected in August 2018</li>
<li>a data set containing data about approximately 7,000 iOS apps from the App Store; the data was collected in July 2017</li>
</ul>
<p>We'll start by opening and exploring these two data sets. To make them easier to explore, we created a function <code>explore_data()</code> that can be used repeatedly to print rows in a readable way.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [1]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">explore_data</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dataset</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">start</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">end</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">rows_and_columns</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">dataset_slice</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">dataset</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">start</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="n">end</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">row</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">dataset_slice</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">row</span><span class="p">)</span>
        
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">rows_and_columns</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Number of rows: '</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dataset</span><span class="p">))</span>
        <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Number of columns: '</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dataset</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]))</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [2]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">csv</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">reader</span>

<span class="c1">## Google Play Store data ##</span>
<span class="n">opened_file</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">open</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'googleplaystore.csv'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">encoding</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'utf8'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">read_file</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">reader</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">opened_file</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">android</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">list</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">read_file</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">android_header</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">android</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">android</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">android</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">:]</span> <span class="c1"># remove the header</span>

<span class="c1">## App Store data ##</span>
<span class="n">opened_file</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">open</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'AppleStore.csv'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">encoding</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'utf8'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">read_file</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">reader</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">opened_file</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ios</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">list</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">read_file</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">ios_header</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ios</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">ios</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">ios</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">:]</span>

<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">android_header</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">explore_data</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">android</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>['App', 'Category', 'Rating', 'Reviews', 'Size', 'Installs', 'Type', 'Price', 'Content Rating', 'Genres', 'Last Updated', 'Current Ver', 'Android Ver']
['Photo Editor & Candy Camera & Grid & ScrapBook', 'ART_AND_DESIGN', '4.1', '159', '19M', '10,000+', 'Free', '0', 'Everyone', 'Art & Design', 'January 7, 2018', '1.0.0', '4.0.3 and up']
['Coloring book moana', 'ART_AND_DESIGN', '3.9', '967', '14M', '500,000+', 'Free', '0', 'Everyone', 'Art & Design;Pretend Play', 'January 15, 2018', '2.0.0', '4.0.3 and up']
['U Launcher Lite – FREE Live Cool Themes, Hide Apps', 'ART_AND_DESIGN', '4.7', '87510', '8.7M', '5,000,000+', 'Free', '0', 'Everyone', 'Art & Design', 'August 1, 2018', '1.2.4', '4.0.3 and up']
['Sketch - Draw & Paint', 'ART_AND_DESIGN', '4.5', '215644', '25M', '50,000,000+', 'Free', '0', 'Teen', 'Art & Design', 'June 8, 2018', 'Varies with device', '4.2 and up']
['Pixel Draw - Number Art Coloring Book', 'ART_AND_DESIGN', '4.3', '967', '2.8M', '100,000+', 'Free', '0', 'Everyone', 'Art & Design;Creativity', 'June 20, 2018', '1.1', '4.4 and up']
Number of rows:  10841
Number of columns:  13
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [3]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ios_header</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">explore_data</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ios</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>['', 'id', 'track_name', 'size_bytes', 'currency', 'price', 'rating_count_tot', 'rating_count_ver', 'user_rating', 'user_rating_ver', 'ver', 'cont_rating', 'prime_genre', 'sup_devices.num', 'ipadSc_urls.num', 'lang.num', 'vpp_lic']
['1', '281656475', 'PAC-MAN Premium', '100788224', 'USD', '3.99', '21292', '26', '4', '4.5', '6.3.5', '4+', 'Games', '38', '5', '10', '1']
['2', '281796108', 'Evernote - stay organized', '158578688', 'USD', '0', '161065', '26', '4', '3.5', '8.2.2', '4+', 'Productivity', '37', '5', '23', '1']
['3', '281940292', 'WeatherBug - Local Weather, Radar, Maps, Alerts', '100524032', 'USD', '0', '188583', '2822', '3.5', '4.5', '5.0.0', '4+', 'Weather', '37', '5', '3', '1']
['4', '282614216', 'eBay: Best App to Buy, Sell, Save! Online Shopping', '128512000', 'USD', '0', '262241', '649', '4', '4.5', '5.10.0', '12+', 'Shopping', '37', '5', '9', '1']
['5', '282935706', 'Bible', '92774400', 'USD', '0', '985920', '5320', '4.5', '5', '7.5.1', '4+', 'Reference', '37', '5', '45', '1']
Number of rows:  7197
Number of columns:  17
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<hr>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Deleting-wrong-data">Deleting wrong data<a class="anchor-link" href="#Deleting-wrong-data">¶</a></h2><p>Before beginning our analysis, we need to make sure the data we analyze is accurate, otherwise the results of our analysis will be wrong. This means that we need to:</p>
<ul>
<li>detect inaccurate data, and correct or remove it</li>
<li>detect duplicate data, and remove the duplicates</li>
</ul>
<p>For this purpose, we only build apps that are free to download and install, and that are directed toward an English-speaking audience. This means that we need to:</p>
<ul>
<li>remove non-English apps like 爱奇艺PPS -《欢乐颂2》电视剧热播</li>
<li>remove apps that aren't free</li>
</ul>
<p>The process of preparing our data for analysis is called <strong>data cleaning</strong>.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [4]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">android</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">10472</span><span class="p">])</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>['Life Made WI-Fi Touchscreen Photo Frame', '1.9', '19', '3.0M', '1,000+', 'Free', '0', 'Everyone', '', 'February 11, 2018', '1.0.19', '4.0 and up']
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<ul>
<li>this row has an error, missing second column for CATEGORY</li>
</ul>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [5]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">del</span> <span class="n">android</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">10472</span><span class="p">]</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<hr>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Removing-duplicate-entries">Removing duplicate entries<a class="anchor-link" href="#Removing-duplicate-entries">¶</a></h2><p>There are many apps in this data set that have duplicate entries. For instance, Instagram has four entries.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [6]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">app</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">android</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="n">name</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">app</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">name</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'Instagram'</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">app</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>['Instagram', 'SOCIAL', '4.5', '66577313', 'Varies with device', '1,000,000,000+', 'Free', '0', 'Teen', 'Social', 'July 31, 2018', 'Varies with device', 'Varies with device']
['Instagram', 'SOCIAL', '4.5', '66577446', 'Varies with device', '1,000,000,000+', 'Free', '0', 'Teen', 'Social', 'July 31, 2018', 'Varies with device', 'Varies with device']
['Instagram', 'SOCIAL', '4.5', '66577313', 'Varies with device', '1,000,000,000+', 'Free', '0', 'Teen', 'Social', 'July 31, 2018', 'Varies with device', 'Varies with device']
['Instagram', 'SOCIAL', '4.5', '66509917', 'Varies with device', '1,000,000,000+', 'Free', '0', 'Teen', 'Social', 'July 31, 2018', 'Varies with device', 'Varies with device']
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>In fact, we can see the total number of duplicate apps.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [7]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">duplicate_apps</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[]</span>
<span class="n">unique_apps</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[]</span>

<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">app</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">android</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="n">name</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">app</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">name</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">unique_apps</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">duplicate_apps</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">name</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">unique_apps</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">name</span><span class="p">)</span>
        
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Number of duplicate apps:'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">duplicate_apps</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Number of duplicate apps: 1181
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Before removing all the duplicate apps, we need to build a criterion on which duplicates to remove. Referring back to the Instagram example, note the 4th value in each duplicate is different. This value represents the number of reviews. As a result, we should keep the list with the highest number of reviews, and remove the rest.</p>
<p>After removing the duplicates we should be left with 9,659 rows.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [8]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Expected length:'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">android</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="mi">1181</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Expected length: 9659
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>To remove the duplicates, we will:</p>
<ul>
<li>create a dictionary, where each dictionary key is a unique app name and the corresponding dictionary value is the highest number of reviews of that app</li>
<li>use the information stored in the dictionary and create a new data set, which will have only one entry per app (we select the entry with the highest number of reviews)</li>
</ul>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [9]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">reviews_max</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{}</span>

<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">app</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">android</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="n">name</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">app</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="n">n_reviews</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">float</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">app</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">])</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">name</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">reviews_max</span> <span class="ow">and</span> <span class="n">reviews_max</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">name</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o"><</span> <span class="n">n_reviews</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">reviews_max</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">name</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">n_reviews</span>
    <span class="k">elif</span> <span class="n">name</span> <span class="ow">not</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">reviews_max</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">reviews_max</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">name</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">n_reviews</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p><code>reviews_max</code> is a dictionary that now stores unique apps only and its highest number of reviews for that app. However, we still need to create a new list that contains the rest of the information as well.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [10]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">android_clean</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[]</span>
<span class="n">already_added</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[]</span>

<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">app</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">android</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="n">name</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">app</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="n">n_reviews</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">float</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">app</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">])</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">n_reviews</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="n">reviews_max</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">name</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="ow">and</span> <span class="n">name</span> <span class="ow">not</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">already_added</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">android_clean</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">app</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">already_added</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">name</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [11]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">explore_data</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">android_clean</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>['Photo Editor & Candy Camera & Grid & ScrapBook', 'ART_AND_DESIGN', '4.1', '159', '19M', '10,000+', 'Free', '0', 'Everyone', 'Art & Design', 'January 7, 2018', '1.0.0', '4.0.3 and up']
['U Launcher Lite – FREE Live Cool Themes, Hide Apps', 'ART_AND_DESIGN', '4.7', '87510', '8.7M', '5,000,000+', 'Free', '0', 'Everyone', 'Art & Design', 'August 1, 2018', '1.2.4', '4.0.3 and up']
['Sketch - Draw & Paint', 'ART_AND_DESIGN', '4.5', '215644', '25M', '50,000,000+', 'Free', '0', 'Teen', 'Art & Design', 'June 8, 2018', 'Varies with device', '4.2 and up']
['Pixel Draw - Number Art Coloring Book', 'ART_AND_DESIGN', '4.3', '967', '2.8M', '100,000+', 'Free', '0', 'Everyone', 'Art & Design;Creativity', 'June 20, 2018', '1.1', '4.4 and up']
['Paper flowers instructions', 'ART_AND_DESIGN', '4.4', '167', '5.6M', '50,000+', 'Free', '0', 'Everyone', 'Art & Design', 'March 26, 2017', '1.0', '2.3 and up']
Number of rows:  9659
Number of columns:  13
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Note that the number of rows (9659) now matches the expected value given earlier. Thus, we've successfully removed the duplicate values.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<hr>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Removing-non-English-apps">Removing non-English apps<a class="anchor-link" href="#Removing-non-English-apps">¶</a></h2><p>Both data sets still have apps with names that suggest they are not directed towards an English-speaking audience.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [12]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">android_clean</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">4412</span><span class="p">][</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">android_clean</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">7940</span><span class="p">][</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>中国語 AQリスニング
لعبة تقدر تربح DZ
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The numbers corresponding to the characters we commonly use in an English text are all in the range 0 to 127, according to the ASCII system. Based on this number range, we can build a function that detects whether a character belongs to the set of common English characters or not.</p>
<p>In Python, strings are indexable and iterable, which means we can use indexing to select an individual character, and we can also iterate on the string using a for loop.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [13]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">string</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'abc'</span>
<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">character</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">string</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">character</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>a
b
c
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Let's write a function that takes in a string and returns <code>False</code> if there's any character in the string that doesn't belong to the set of common English characters, otherwise it returns <code>True</code>.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [14]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">is_english</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">string</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">character</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">string</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="k">if</span> <span class="nb">ord</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">character</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">></span> <span class="mi">127</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="k">return</span> <span class="kc">False</span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="kc">True</span>

<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">is_english</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Instagram'</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">is_english</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'爱奇艺PPS -《欢乐颂2》电视剧热播'</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">is_english</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Instachat 😜'</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>True
False
False
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Note that the last app didn't satisfy the quality check because of the emojii. So instead, we'll only remove an app if its name has more than three characters with corresponding numbers falling outside the ASCII range.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [15]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">is_english</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">string</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">non_ascii</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">0</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">character</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">string</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="k">if</span> <span class="nb">ord</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">character</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">></span> <span class="mi">127</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="n">non_ascii</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="mi">1</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">non_ascii</span> <span class="o">></span> <span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="kc">False</span>
    <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="kc">True</span>
    
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">is_english</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Docs To Go™ Free Office Suite'</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">is_english</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Instachat 😜'</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>True
True
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [16]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">android_english</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[]</span>
<span class="n">ios_english</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[]</span>

<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">app</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">android_clean</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="n">name</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">app</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">is_english</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">name</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="n">android_english</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">app</span><span class="p">)</span>
        
<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">app</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">ios</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="n">name</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">app</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">is_english</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">name</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="n">ios_english</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">app</span><span class="p">)</span>
        
<span class="n">explore_data</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">android_english</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">explore_data</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ios_english</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">

['U Launcher Lite – FREE Live Cool Themes, Hide Apps', 'ART_AND_DESIGN', '4.7', '87510', '8.7M', '5,000,000+', 'Free', '0', 'Everyone', 'Art & Design', 'August 1, 2018', '1.2.4', '4.0.3 and up']
['Sketch - Draw & Paint', 'ART_AND_DESIGN', '4.5', '215644', '25M', '50,000,000+', 'Free', '0', 'Teen', 'Art & Design', 'June 8, 2018', 'Varies with device', '4.2 and up']

['2', '281796108', 'Evernote - stay organized', '158578688', 'USD', '0', '161065', '26', '4', '3.5', '8.2.2', '4+', 'Productivity', '37', '5', '23', '1']
['3', '281940292', 'WeatherBug - Local Weather, Radar, Maps, Alerts', '100524032', 'USD', '0', '188583', '2822', '3.5', '4.5', '5.0.0', '4+', 'Weather', '37', '5', '3', '1']

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<hr>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Isolating-the-free-apps">Isolating the free apps<a class="anchor-link" href="#Isolating-the-free-apps">¶</a></h2><p>Isolating the free apps will be our last step in the data cleaning process.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [17]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">android_final</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[]</span>
<span class="n">ios_final</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[]</span>

<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">app</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">android_english</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="n">price</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">app</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">7</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">price</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'0'</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">android_final</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">app</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">app</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">ios_english</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="n">price</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">app</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">price</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'0'</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">ios_final</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">app</span><span class="p">)</span>
        
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">android_final</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ios_final</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>8864
3222
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We're left with 8,864 Android apps and 4,056 iOS apps, which should be enough for our analysis.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<hr>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Most-common-apps-by-genre">Most common apps by genre<a class="anchor-link" href="#Most-common-apps-by-genre">¶</a></h2><p>Our aim is to determine the kinds of apps that are likely to attract more users because our revenue is highly influenced by the number of people using our apps.</p>
<p>To minimize risks and overhead, our validation strategy for an app idea is comprised of three steps:</p>
<ol>
<li>build a minimal Android version of the app, and add it to Google Play</li>
<li>if the app has a good response from users, we develop it further</li>
<li>if the app is profitable after six months, we build an iOS version of the app and add it to the App Store</li>
</ol>
<p>Let's begin the analysis by getting a sense of the most common genres for each market. For this, we'll build a frequency table for the <code>prime_genre</code> column of the App Store data set, and the <code>Genres</code> and <code>Category</code> columns of the Google Play data set.</p>
<p>We'll build two functions we can use to analyze the frequency tables:</p>
<ul>
<li>one function to generate frequency tables that show perentages</li>
<li>another function we can use to display the percentages in a descending order</li>
</ul>
<p>We can sort entries in the frequency table by using the built-in <code>sorted()</code> function. This function takes in an iterable data type and returns a list of the elements sorted in ascending or descending order (the <code>reverse</code> parameter controls the order).</p>
<p>The <code>sorted()</code> function doesn't work too well with dictionaries because it only considers and returns the dictionary keys.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [18]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">freq_table</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'Genre_1'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mi">50</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Genre_3'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mi">20</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Genre_2'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mi">100</span><span class="p">}</span>
<span class="nb">sorted</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">freq_table</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[18]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>['Genre_1', 'Genre_2', 'Genre_3']</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>However, the <code>sorted()</code> function works well if we transform the dictionary into a list of tuples.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [19]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">freq_table</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[(</span><span class="mi">50</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Genre_1'</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">20</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Genre_3'</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">100</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'Genre_2'</span><span class="p">)]</span>
<span class="nb">sorted</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">freq_table</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt output_prompt">Out[19]:</div>




<div class="output_text output_subarea output_execute_result">
<pre>[(20, 'Genre_3'), (50, 'Genre_1'), (100, 'Genre_2')]</pre>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Let's now create a function for generating frequency tables, and use it in combination with the <code>display_table()</code> function we will define later.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [20]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">freq_table</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dataset</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">index</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">table</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{}</span>
    <span class="n">total</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">0</span>
    
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">row</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">dataset</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">total</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="mi">1</span>
        <span class="n">value</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">row</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">index</span><span class="p">]</span>
        <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">value</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">table</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="n">table</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">value</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="mi">1</span>
        <span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="n">table</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">value</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1</span>
    
    <span class="n">table_percentages</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{}</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">key</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">table</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">percentage</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">table</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">key</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="n">total</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="mi">100</span>
        <span class="n">table_percentages</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">key</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">percentage</span> 
    
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">table_percentages</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The helper function <code>display_table()</code> below transforms the frequency table into a list of tuples, then sorts the list in a descending order.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [21]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">display_table</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dataset</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">index</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">table</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">freq_table</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dataset</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">index</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">table_display</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[]</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">key</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">table</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">key_val_as_tuple</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">table</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">key</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">key</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">table_display</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">key_val_as_tuple</span><span class="p">)</span>

    <span class="n">table_sorted</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">sorted</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">table_display</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">reverse</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">entry</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">table_sorted</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">entry</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="s1">':'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">entry</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">])</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We start by examining the frequency table for the <code>prime_genre</code> column of the App Store data set.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [22]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">display_table</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ios_final</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">

</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We can see that among the free English apps, more than half (55.65%) are games. Entertainment apps are slightly above 8%, followed by photo and video apps, which are close to 5%.</p>
<p>The general impression is that the App Store is dominated by apps that are designed for fun (games, entertainment, photo and video, social networking, sports, music, etc.), while apps with practical purposes (utility, poductivity, lifestyle, etc.) are more rare. However, the fact that fun apps are the most numerous doesn't also imply that they also have the greatest number of users – the demand might not be the same as the offer.</p>
<p>Let's continue by examining the <code>Genres</code> and <code>Category</code> columns of the Google Play data set.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [23]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">display_table</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">android_final</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>FAMILY : 18.907942238267147
GAME : 9.724729241877256
TOOLS : 8.461191335740072
BUSINESS : 4.591606498194946
LIFESTYLE : 3.9034296028880866
PRODUCTIVITY : 3.892148014440433
FINANCE : 3.7003610108303246
MEDICAL : 3.531137184115524

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The landscape seems different on Google Play. There are not that many apps designed for fun, and it seems that a good number of apps are designed for practical purposes (family, tools, business, lifestyle, productivity, etc.). However, if we investigate this further, we see that the family category means mostly games for kids.</p>
<p>Up to this point, we found that the App Store is dominated by apps designed for fun, while Google Play shows a more balanced landscape of both practical and for-fun apps. Now we'd like to get an idea about the kind of apps that have most users.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<hr>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Most-popular-apps-by-genre-on-the-App-Store">Most popular apps by genre on the App Store<a class="anchor-link" href="#Most-popular-apps-by-genre-on-the-App-Store">¶</a></h2><p>One way to find out what genres are the most popular is to calculate the average number of installs for each app genre. For the Google Play data set, we can find this information in the <code>Installs</code> column, but this information is missing for the App Store data set. As a workaround, we'll take the total number of user ratings as a proxy, which we can find in <code>rating_count_tot</code>.</p>
<p>Let's start with calculating the average number of user ratings per app genre on the App Store. To do that, we'll need to:</p>
<ul>
<li>isolate the apps of each genre</li>
<li>sum up the user ratings for the apps of that genre</li>
<li>divide the sum by the number of apps belonging to that genre</li>
</ul>
<p>We'll use a nested loop to compute the averages we mentioned above.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [24]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">genres_ios</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">freq_table</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ios_final</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">genre</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">genres_ios</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="n">total</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">0</span>
    <span class="n">len_genre</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">0</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">app</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">ios_final</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">genre_app</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">app</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">]</span>
        <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">genre_app</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="n">genre</span><span class="p">:</span>
            <span class="n">n_ratings</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">float</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">app</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">6</span><span class="p">])</span>
            <span class="n">total</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="n">n_ratings</span>
            <span class="n">len_genre</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="mi">1</span>
    <span class="n">avg_n_ratings</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">total</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="n">len_genre</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">genre</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">':'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">avg_n_ratings</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Productivity : 21028.410714285714

</div>
</div>

</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>On average, navigation apps have a high number of user reviews, but this figure is heavily influenced by Waze and Google Maps.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [25]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">app</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">ios_final</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">app</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'Navigation'</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">app</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="s1">':'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">app</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">6</span><span class="p">])</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Waze - GPS Navigation, Maps & Real-time Traffic : 345046
Geocaching® : 12811

Railway Route Search : 5

Google Maps - Navigation & Transit : 154911
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The same pattern applies to social networking apps, where the average number is heavily influenced by a few giants like Facebook, Pintrest, Skype, etc.</p>
<p>For the Google Play market, we actually have data about the number of installs, so we should be able to get a clearer picture about genre popularity.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [26]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">display_table</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">android_final</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>1,000,000+ : 15.726534296028879
100,000+ : 11.552346570397113
