</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>To perform computations, however, we'll need to convert each install number to <code>float</code> – this means that we need to remove the commans and the plus characters.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [27]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">categories_android</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">freq_table</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">android_final</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">category</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">categories_android</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="n">total</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">0</span>
    <span class="n">len_category</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">0</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">app</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">android_final</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="n">category_app</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">app</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span>
        <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">category_app</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="n">category</span><span class="p">:</span>            
            <span class="n">n_installs</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">app</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">]</span>
            <span class="n">n_installs</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">n_installs</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">','</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">''</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="n">n_installs</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">n_installs</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">replace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'+'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">''</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="n">total</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="nb">float</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">n_installs</span><span class="p">)</span>
            <span class="n">len_category</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="mi">1</span>
    <span class="n">avg_n_installs</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">total</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="n">len_category</span>
    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">category</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">':'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">avg_n_installs</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>On average, communication apps have the most installs: 38,456,119. This number is heavily skewed up by a few apps that have over one billion installs.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [28]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">app</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">android_final</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">app</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'COMMUNICATION'</span> <span class="ow">and</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">app</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'1,000,000,000+'</span> <span class="ow">or</span> <span class="n">app</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'500,000,000+'</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">app</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="s1">':'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">app</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">])</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>The book and reference genre includes a variety of apps. It seems there's still a small number of extremely popular apps that skew the average (unlike other categories).</p>

<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [29]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">app</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">android_final</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">app</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'BOOKS_AND_REFERENCE'</span> <span class="ow">and</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">app</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'1,000,000,000+'</span> <span class="ow">or</span> <span class="n">app</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s1">'500,000,000+'</span><span class="p">):</span>
        <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">app</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="s1">':'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">app</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">])</span>
</pre></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

    <div class="prompt"></div>


<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>Google Play Books : 1,000,000,000+
</pre>
</div>
</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We see that there are few apps built around books, which suggests that building an app around a popular book can be profitable. It seems that taking a popular book (perhaps a more recent book) and turning it into an app could be profitable for both the Google Play and the App Store markets.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<hr>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Conclusions">Conclusions<a class="anchor-link" href="#Conclusions">¶</a></h2><p>In this project, we analyzed data about the App Store and Google Play mobile apps with the goal of recommending an app profile that can be profitable for both markets.</p>
<p>We concluded that taking a popular book (perhaps a more recent book) and turning it into an app could be profitable for both the Google Play and the App Store markets. The markets are already full of libraries, so we need to add some special features besides the raw version of the book. This might include daily quotes from the book, an audio version of the book, quizzes on the book, a forum where people can discuss the book, etc.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
